description:
Terrible!!! Just called in to place an order at 12pm 10/26. A young man answered and asked me to hold. He then sat the phone down and had 15 min worth of conversations with a man and woman about everything from hermosa beach to how strange California is and how he is from here. So not professional! Disappointing and you have lost a SF native customer. 

FYI also just tried to call back after hanging up and line is still busy. Guess he decided to leave off the hook


Update to my review. The owner jerry reached out to me quickly. He definitely changed my opinion about the customer service. I really appreciate him reaching out to me and correcting this issue. Excited to post a review about how tasty the food is.
author: Ginger G.

description:
Handy Deli has some seriously delicious sandwiches! They just recently switched up their bread to Acme bakery, and their sandwiches are even tastier. I love the Frisco Club!

On top of their excellent sandwiches they carry Mediterranean options as well like shawarma, baklava, and many others. 

They have an extensive selection of brews, wines, and spirits.  Handy Deli is truly the gem of the neighborhood!
author: Janelle D.

description:
Wow!!!! What a pleasant surprise.  The food is fresh and flavorful- obviously made with love.  I believe the deli is owner-operated.  

My boyfriend is from Israel and said that the hummus taste like his mom's. 

We ordered baked chicken, tuna salad, chicken salad, hummus, the ruben sandwich, and the cubano sandwich.  

I do not eat bread and they made the sandwiches as lettuce wraps for me (as a recommendation from the owner instead of making it a salad), and I could still hold it and bite it like a sandwich.  This is a game-changer for me, because I can now order all the sandwiches on the menu!

There is an excellent beer and wine selection here, as well. 

I'm a customer for life! Go try it for yourself!
author: Meagan M.

description:
You would never expect such unique flavors to come from a liquor store! I've just about everything on the menu and you can't go wrong. The CHICKEN SHWARAMA is ERMEGHERD Questionably the best in the SF. Plus they're always willing to alter things for my food allergies. They have vegetarian/vegan options and I can make anything gluten free with lettuce wraps or a hot plate. 
This place is literally like 80% of the reason I wouldn't leave the sunset! You Adopt a new friend when you meet the owners and the employees. Super chill vibe.
author: Angela H.

description:
I have been wanting a Pastrami sandwich for days. This was THE BEST PASTRAMI SANDWICH EVER. The very helpful couple who I assume are the owners were very helpful and patient with me because I had a few questions about bread and toppings. Will most definitely be trying more of their sandwiches soon.
UPDATE: So before I left the area heading back home on the other side if the bridge I ordered a Roast beef sandwich for dinner. It was sooooo tender it melted in my mouth. Now I'm torn between the 2. Think I'll make them part of my weekly Date Day with my Otha Half.
author: Tamika J.

description: This deli has the best quality as a 5 star caffe !! They make everything from scratch!! Their home made hummus is top notch and don't forget to try their pesto  I tried one of the breakfast menu sandwiches and it was a hit (it's called Serious) and I can't wait to try the rest of the menu !!
author: Lulu R.

description: Really great chicken, omg so delicious. Great selection of food and drinks plus outside seating to enjoy their really fresh sandwiches.
author: Jessica f.

description: Hands down one of the best falafel/shwarma wraps I've ever had! I went in about a week ago and ordered a chicken shwarma with falafel. When the wrap came out, it was the size of a stick of dynamite! The explosion of flavors made it taste like one too. The family who owns and runs the store is hilarious and very kind. The atmosphere is very warm and welcoming. My girlfriend got the bravo sandwich and that looked amazing too. I would've have ate her food too but the wrap had me stuffed! I'm definitely going to visit again
author: Alvin T.

description: I HATE avocados but the Frisco club is THE TRUTH! Just go try it, I promise you'll like it!
author: Paris H.

description:
This place has some good hot sandwiches. My favorite is the Bistro sandwich with house sauce, a must try!

However, on Fridays, the deli has the lamb shawarma wrap/plate that is off the chart!! 

Friendly staff and awesome food, what more can you ask for a wholesome lunch?
author: Jonathan C.

description: I came in to get something for lunch.  There food is incredible.  I am new to the area, but this will be my new "go to" place.  The people that work there were helpful and service is good.
author: Misty M.

description:
The best liquor store AND deli in the entire city, and I've lived all over. Reasons! 
1) Amazing owners and staff (this cannot be stressed enough)
2) legit deli, not just a corner store deli - they have hot food too
3) a massive liquor selection which rivals some of the biggest liquor stores in this city (note it is hard to fine mezcal - they had 5 options...).
In short they did a remodel 4 or 5 years ago to become a more extensive liquor store and a better deli, and it was totally worth it! It's super classy and is still - by far - the best in SF. I moved away from the Sunset a few years ago but whenever I'm in the area I visit these guys and always get a great deal and great laughs. If you have the option, do yourself a favor and become a regular - they will reward it!
author: Lauren S.

description: I love handy deli i get food there every day. The chicken is fall off the bone good. Also carry a large amount of luxury liquors
author: Jory G.

description: Having been twice I can honestly say this place has lovely customer service; where they'll even hand out new items to try while you wait for your sandwich. Definitely coming back regularly for those tasty yet fresh sandwiches.
author: Juliette R.

description:
I consider myself a pretty knowledgeable guy on Rubens. I order them everywhere and rate them on a scale of 1-10. I have a list of a few dozen locations; it's a little nerdy but it's who I am and what I do. This deli forced me to adjust my scale because they made a Ruben so delicious that it knocked my socks off. I want to drive the 22 hours back there for that sandwich. I think about it a lot. 

My white whale that has ruined all future sandwiches for me. 

I would recommend these guys.
author: David V.

description: They have delicious sandwiches! Recently they have acquired a new bread source, and the herb focaccia is unbelievably good on the Frisco Club. I'm drooling a little thinking of it. The beer and wine section is ample and they ALWAYS, have 50% off decent wines!  They also have a very familial vibe, and have become my favorite neighborhood Deli.
author: Jerusha M.

description: Super great people and really amazing sandwiches!!!!!! They make everything  fresh every day and don't skimp on anything. I work in the hood and we all eat here a few times a week. Highly recommend!!!!
author: beth g.

description: The sandwiches are the best and they can make them gluten free on lettuce. Great thoughtful selection of craft beer, wine & spirits too. Family owned and the customer service is always outstanding. It is always a pleasure to shop here.
author: Glenn D.

description: They will make you anything you want at the deli.  The personal attention can't be beat.  Plus it's family owned and oper
author: Matthew T.

description:
Jerry and Manny know what's up!! I've lived up the street for nearly a decade and this is my go-to sando spot. Best breakfast sandwiches in the city, hands down. I love how much pride, research, and creativity make this unassuming bodega a true treasure in the Sunset.
The beverage and snack selection is on point, making it a must stop before heading to the beach.
The roasted chicken dinner is a bargain and you can tell a lot of love goes into their house prepared meals. Just not what you would ever expect from a bodega on the west coast. 
If you need to grab a fancy bottle of wine (or whiskey!) for a night with friends, talk to Jerry. He is a legit sommelier and can point you in the right direction within your budget. Don't drink booze? I don't either! But I'm always excited to see what kinds of new fancy sodas are in the rotation. 
I've been keeping this spot all to my hood for too long, and it's high time to give Handy Deli some Yelp love (before I go grab a little picnic meal for the beach!)
author: Nitalia P.

description: Get to the city, hungry and all of the sudden you find the perfect deli. As you walk in you can smell the rosemary chicken and fresh salsa. Got the Frisco BLT sandwich and it is great. The lady behind the counter helped me make.the right choice
author: William C.

description: This is the best sandwiches we ever had, the bread is so Yummy and their lamb shawerma so good too, the staff are friendly and kind the Owner very nice with his costumers.
author: Reem O.

description: The rosemary chicken is bomb. They hand-pull it for the chicken cardini sandwich, which I crave on the reg. They changed the bread recently, but it just went from great to great. My wife is all about the falafel wrap. Also, the owners are the sweetest and excited to talk to their customers. Beer prices are surprisingly good, too. And they have a nice selection of sweet tooth satisfiers.
author: Belle K.

description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood sandwich spots! I've been eating at Handy Deli for years now and they never disappoint! I've eaten practically the whole menu and my favorites are the chicken shwarma wrap, Frisco Club, and ALL of their breakfast sandwiches. Speaking of which, their breakfast sandwiches are a hidden gem - so many great combos and always fresh ingredients, delicious, and filling for under $10, the value can't be beat! My wife and I love bringing our friends here and usually call in our orders ahead of time. I dig the neighborhood vibe; I feel like I'm walking into my aunt and uncle's kitchen and am always greeted by friendly staff (or family helpers?). Oh they also have all the basics - decent wine and beer selection, snacks, and side dish foods like freshly made hummus, Greek salads, baklava, and other assorted foods. I highly recommend this spot for a quick bite on the go (they do have a couple small tables to eat there outside the store).
author: David L.

description: Handy deli has bomb, generously sized sandwiches! They now have Acme bread and it's always fresh! You won't be disappointed with the food and service. The owners are always there to welcome me.
author: Myrna G.

description: This place is my new found home they have the best sandwiches ever and I mean it literally. They are Very nice people they treat everyone with respect when they come in and again the food is just awesome. I recommend the Frisco club just like the guy in front did for me because now I'm in heaven with my new found family!
author: LaTisha L.

description:
A solid neighborhood deli and convenience store with a huge array of offerings.

As for the store portion, they've got a huge selection of drinks and packaged foods for all your last-minute boozin' and partyin' needs. As for the deli, not only do they offer meats and cheeses by the quarter pound, but they also make quality cold and hot sandwiches on demand.

A chicken shawarma sandwich, for example, was a gigantic helping of marinated shredded chicken and was complemented richly and deliciously with hummus, tomatoes, cucumbers, pickles, and tahini sauce. It's so big, in fact, that half of it is satisfying enough for a meal. You can refrigerate and save the other half for later. Given the portion size and overall quality, the prices are quite decent.

The folks here are super friendly too. Although they take their time preparing orders, you at least know that they're not being sloppy or cutting corners in any way (say, when it comes to health standards or when it comes to simply making a quality sandwich). Highly recommended!
author: Vincent L.

description: Amazing sandwiches! I found Handy Deli through ubereats when I was searching for dinner and have ordered from there twice in the past few days. first the veggie club and tonight I had an eggplant sandwich that was one of the best things I've ever eaten! Pictures don't do the sandwich any justice, it tasted incredible. They are generous with the vegetables, which are really fresh. The sandwiches are very filling. Im vegan and sometimes a veggie sandwich by itself isn't enough to fill me but both of the sandwiches I've had here were like a whole meal. Definitely worth the money. Plus Im a picky eater and always make a request to modify my sandwich a little and they always do so! Thanks to their patient workers for being so accommodating! I'm looking forward to trying the falafel wrap soon, I would happily recommend this place to anyone!
author: Donna S.

description: This is the place to go for the yummiest deli sandwich along Highway 1 in San Francisco. The meat is well seasoned, the veggies are fresh, and the menu is classic.
author: Jacqueline P.

description: Took my 9 year old son here for lunch and we both loved it! Couldn't decide on what to get because everything looked so good! My son said it was amazing and I would agree!
author: Michael D.

description:
Some of the reviewers recommended the Bistro sandwich -- Basically a variant of a Philly Cheesesteak.  The staff were perfectly friendly and nice, but sorry the sandwich was mediocre, at best.

If you happen to find yourself in Berkeley, on the south side of campus, try IB Hoagies -- It's about 17,000 times better and a lot closer than Philadelphia.
author: David C.

description:
The falafel supreme is not as good as it was when I first had it in 2014 and a few times later. 

I tried it twice, this year before I updated my review. Different personnel prepared the wrap on each visit. So, my assumption is what I got is the standard.


Service was fine. The store is well kept. Maybe, I should try something else, someday.
author: Debbie T.

description: Amazing! Handy Deli saved the day and catered an event at a conference for my company with less than 24 hours notice! The driver was a delight, the food was delicious, and our guests were happy. Who could ask for more?
author: Hillary H.

description:
Handy deli is more than your typical San Francisco corner store. It has an fast and amazing deli with delicious and well priced sandwiches. There's a cute patio set outside to eat. The owner and employees are kind and happy to help. It has a great selection of craft beer and liquor and is the best place in San Francisco to get and return kegs. 

I didn't realize I could get kegs from this shop, it didn't pop up under the yelp search, so I regrettably got a keg from New Star-Ell Liquor on Fell and Divisadero and had an awful experience. 

Thankfully Handy Deli saved my day and took back the kegs I had got from New Star and gave me a full refund even though I had not got the kegs from them. (New star would only offer me half the refund and on top of that, refused to correct an overcharge they had mistakenly made.) I super appreciate Handy deli going out of their way to help a competitor's customer, it really shows that they're good people! Now this is the only place I'll get kegs in the city now!
author: Gabriella B.

description: Super cute family owned liquor store and deli. The sandwiches are bomb and the liquor is priced pretty reasonably for its location. There's a wide verity of sandwich options sometimes it's hard to pick just one! The staff is soo kind and makes sure you're taken care of.
author: Ashley D.

description: Ordered delivery from eat24. The food arrived on time and was in good condition. We ordered the bistro samdwich, rueben, and turkey pesto sandwiches, a Greek salad, potato salad and macaroni salad. The bistro was disappointing. It's hard to put my finger on exactly why. Maybe it needed salt, maybe it needed a sauce? It just tasted flavorless unfortunately. The rueben was very good. I would certainly order that again. I just wish there was more pastrami on the rueben. The picture of the rueben on yelp doesn't reflect the rueben I got. Maybe that is a special one with extra meat. The salad was extremely boring. Little to no dressing and the ingredients dod not seem fresh. The potato and macaroni salad were also very bad. They tasted like they had been coated in lemon juice or something that gave a weird acidic taste and make my tongue tingle when I ate it. We threw those out as well as the salad. The rueben was the saving grace for me. I didn't try the turkey pesto, so no comments on that. I wish the bistro was better, that looked like a great sandwich from pictures and seemed to be their signature. Oh well...
author: John W.

description: Omg!!! I had the best roast beef sandwich there today! It was delicious. The meat was so fresh. I can't wait to go back and try something else.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Love the authenticity of this place. A gen of real deli ownership - and they care about their ingredients and their customers. We popped in for a snack and ordered the Chicken Marsala sandwiches -- they were real yummy!
author: Mark J.

description:
I use to really like this place, but have had bad experiences the last two times I visited here.

On one visit, I ordered the Di Parma sandwich.  They must have shaved a pretty tough part of the prosciutto for my sandwich because it was hard like plastic.  I had to throw half the meat away.

I decided to give them another shot and ordered again.  This time I used Eat 24.  When I got there, they hadn't started my order even though they gave me a confirmed time online.  I ordered at 12:53 and the confirmed time was 1:23, so it wasn't a very ambitious time to meet.  They said their system was down and I'd have to wait.  When I first received my order, they gave me someone else's order instead and they claimed that was what I ordered; I had to show them my order my phone for them to take it back.  Then they gave me my order, but it was missing the  meat I had added to my online order.  Finally, after a third try, they got my order correct.

It's really too bad because it's a neighborhood shop and they use to have good service and quality food.
author: R L.

description: I live two blocks away and each time I've eaten here it's  been tasty.. However today I got a sandwich with a screw in it. Yes, the type that holds machines together. I bit it and luckily my tooth didn't crack! I feel obliged to share this horrific news because it's an extreme safety issue. Not only that, the screw had plastic on it too. No amount of fair prices and flavor could convince me to turn my cheek the other way. Sadly I will never come back here.. You've been warned.
author: Leelee E.

description: This place is bad ass. Hands down the best sandwich place on the block. There is a lot of competition but the extra love and passion goes to this place. If I were that sandwich I would have eaten myself. The beer selection in the cold, cold coolers are to die for...I get something different each time I go and I am never disappointed.
author: Gordians K.

description:
Love this place. Huge selection of beer from all over the world. Wine and allllll types of liquor. 
It's small and family owned 
Staff is super helpful and knowledgeable about all products. 
I've come in looking for something simple.. Always leaving with something special. 
The deli is magnificent ... Great food ... Never too long a wait.
author: Frances L.

description:
Damn, this place is the bomb.com.  Jerry is awesome and you can taste his passion for great food. Everything is homemade and amazing. I had the Turkey Lulu sandwich (turkey roasted in house, and the walnut pesto is incredible) and everything about it was perfect and not fattening ;o). My boyfriend had the Bistro sandwich (basically a cheese steak with all fresh or homemade ingredients including the beef being roasted in house!!!!!) and it was so delicious.  It was our first of many visits to this place. We will definitely become regulars.  

PS: great beer, wine and liquor selection too.
author: Sarah S.

description: We stumbled into the Handy Deli after a paddleboat ride on nearby Stowe Lake in SF's Golden Gate Park on our way to the airport. We found it on Google Maps and were not expecting much, just something to nosh on during our long flight back east. Boy, were we pleasantly surprised. It's basically a neighborhood store, but their small kitchen in the front bay window turns out some amazing sandwiches, especially the Frisco chicken sandwich, made with fresh chickens cooked right there.  The family that runs the place couldn't be more pleasant. We wish we had found it earlier in our trip.
author: John C.

description:
These guys are so nice every time I come in! I crave their rosemary chicken when I want something healthier for lunch. I hear that their sandwiches are good as well! Typically I can't finish my whole plate anyways, so I save some for dinner. :) 

They have a variety of snacks and drinks as well--even some cheese and some other delicacies, such as baklava and nougat candies. Keep it up, Handy Deli! I appreciate the service and quality you guys maintain. Until next time!
author: Mariel A.

description:
I was hankering for a shawerma yesterday and spent some serious time doing research on Yelp.  After way more time than I care to admit, I got off the N-Judah on 19th Ave. with the intention of going to another deli close by for one, but then the hand-painted sign for Handy, a sign that I have seen hundreds of times in the past, made me curious about exactly what this place, seemingly more liquor store than deli, has to offer me.  So I started looking at their online menu on the sidewalk, braving the strong wind that is blowing my hair willy-nilly.  But, lo and behold, they actually offer chicken shawerma!  They also have a slew of loyal regular customers, to read their reviews.  So, in I went.  While waiting for my food, I had a chance to look around and noticed that they have quite a selection of whisky, including a variety of Japanese ones.  Interesting...

Anyway, back to the food, that ended up being my dinner and it was delicious!!  The wrap was perfectly creamy from the mix of tahini and hummus.  It included pickle logs, cubes of cucumbers and tomatoes and chunks of moist and tasty chicken. The lavash was toasted beforehand.  The portion was very generous and I was only able to finish half of it.  I ate the other half for breakfast this morning and enjoyed it just the same.  I liked it so much I'm already planning on when to return and what else to order next time!
author: Yvette F.

description: Best beer collection in the city, very clean and super delicious food. Jery is very nice person and their prices are responsible
author: Steve A.

description:
Not the cheapest of alcohol, but pretty standard for a corner store.

The food is great. Great sandwiches, great plates, great shawarmas at reasonable prices. Extremely friendly service, which is always a pleasant bonus.

Parking may be challenging if you're not here outside of weekday work hours.
author: Douglas Y.

description:
Guy at the counter recommended the chicken shawarma and it was SOOO good!
I have no complaints, this place is a hidden gem. Wish they had some indoor seating (only have a couple outdoor tables), but still great for take-out or a quick bite!
author: Kimia M.

description:
I bussed it from LA for a 1 day hike adventure. Stopped here after I saw how near it was from where I was when I checked in to yelp. Given that I was super exhausted from all the hiking I did, this place was super convenient for me -- and I'm glad it was too. 

The main dude was really nice. Hooked it up with a free drink since I was new to the Deli and the city. Nabbed me a vitamin water to wash down number 1 on the menu. I forgot what the name of the sandwich was but, it involved chicken and bacon. He kept telling me that everything they serve there was made by them. I took that as: nothing there is frozen bs food. Okay. I ate the sandwich. Yo, that sub is in my top two fav sandwiches, along with the Manhattan sandwich from Alondra Hot Wings. You gotta stop here. 

Now, if you're going to eat there, I gotta tell you that there is only two coop tables available. Not a family friendly type thing; unless, you take it to go. 

Check the spot out.
author: Mike C.

description: Awesome little nondescript deli on the corner of 19th and Irving. Stopped in for a snack on the way to the airport. Straight forward liquor store with fifteen foot wall ceilings of just about every bottle you can imagine, plus a big wine selection (cold also available). But tucked into a corner near the cash register is a selection of grab-and-go homemade items like hummus, falafel, and dolmas. Such good quality food!! Will absolutely make this a stop every time I head to SFO.
author: Jacquelynne O.

description: Super nice counter guy who just survived at shark encounter in Santa Cruz chatted us up while our delicious sandwiches were made.  Highly recommend the turkey club.  Super good sour dough bread and a very nice experience.
author: Michelle D.

description: Great beer selection for craft beer fans. Owner is super nice and responsive. $10 meals are super tasty and convenient for an easy weeknight dinner.
author: Jon S.

description:
Jerry and his family and staff are fantastic! 
And with Jerry's new cooler, Handy Deli has,without a doubt THE COLDEST BEER IN TOWN,  and that's a fact Jack!!!!!
author: Jim R.

description:
After my previous review Jerry was kind enough to reach out to me to invite me back to try a sandwich on them. I visited at a more reasonable hour yesterday (~5 pm) and went with a Sunset Blue on whole wheat. Verdict: very good. The sandwich was quite tasty - at the very least much better than I could make on my own! (Though admittedly that may not be a very high bar to clear.) There was a plentiful amount of roast beef and the umami gorgonzola contrasting nicely with the slightly sweet citrus vinaigrette.

More important, however, is how warm and friendly Jerry was. During the 5 or 10 minutes I waited for my sandwich to be made I saw him greet multiple visitors by name - clearly this is a place that engenders loyalty. Looking forward to my next visit!
author: John W.

description: I was really surprised at how good the rosemary chicken was  For $8.50 you get a large chicken breast with salad and rice.  It was a really good deal.
author: Mark P.

description:
First I love this place!
The owner (Jerry) and the Staff are great and always friendly.
They have the best Wine, Beer, and Spirits selection and best prices in town.
They're very knowledgeable about everything and they're more than willing to help and find anything you need.

Their Sandwiches are the Best in town. Always Fresh and Delicious. This is a great place to stop and grab a sandwich. They have two tables with chairs outdoor to sit and eat.

They have large selection of Ginger Beer and Root Beer. Verity of Crackers and Cheeses.
author: Mohammed Z.

description:
Ammmmmmaaazing!!! The food that they make tastes like home made food! If I can eat here everyday, I would;) 
Jerry and his wife are so friendly, this place is awesome.
I had the chicken with rice and beans, also the soup was fantastic. I've always ordered sandwiches and they were always great but now I've been ordering their hot meals;;;)
author: janat s.

description: GREAT little sandwich shop/deli with a very friendly owner who makes really good sandwiches. If you visit Golden Gate Park this is a great spot to stop and grab a bite before heading to your next destination.  Would definitely recommend.
author: Clay W.

description:
Handy Deli gets high props for having such a vast inventory of microbrews, juices, energy drinks,  some wines, and  some hard liquor. most of the beers were priced.  (reasonable to pricey)

they have snacks on the floor and sammies (6.5ish) in the corner. just a few persons in line caused a backup so i just got 2 lotto tics and split.

it a small store with lots of good stuff to sell.....
author: Victor G.

description:
Small business with killer house made roast beef, medium rare tender perfection! Nice to have a neighborhood deli that actually makes their own food and offer daily home made specialties. 

Dutch Crunch A Must!!! 

Did I mention the prices? On point! With sandwiches averaging 6 bucks! This place is a bit cramped so expect to stand in close proximity to other humans hungry and willing to knock you down to get their order. The owners couldn't be more helpful, taking orders, managing the store, making you feel welcome. Need I say more? No. Just shut up and eat...
author: Nick C.

description: OMG. If any of you guys are planning on getting the BLT, please DO NOT. The so called "bacon" in it was brown and extremely burnt to an absolute crisp. It was also overbearingly salty to the point where I had to take out almost all of it. You know when you eat a bunch of sour patch kids and your tongue peels? Well, that's what happened to me. Basically it was not bacon. Save yourself the time and money and just make yourself a sandwich at home because this place is not the business.
author: Elle L.

description: I've been getting sandwiches here lately - I really like the frisco club with chicken! It's fresh roasted chicken (I assume a chicken quarter) with bacon, cheese, avocado, and I add pesto to make it even more tasty! It's super filling and y'all know I eat a lot hehe.  I've tried their Saturday special sandwich and it was really good! I think I may have to get it again! The hubby has gotten the lamb schwarma on a Friday and it was really good and super filling! He couldn't even finish it and that's saying a lot! Be sure to get the hot sauce with it - it's actually hot which we love.  I'm glad I have a lunch option that's walkable from our house that isn't Asian food! I need variety sometimes :).
author: Julie F.

description: This place is the GS Warriors of sandwiches. The Shwarma was the Klay Thomson - really good and well rounded. It fell under the shadow of the MVP though - The Bistro. The Steph Curry of sandwiches dropped a half court shot with pure confidence. The Caprese salad was Andrew Bogut - it got the job done but has room for improvement. The staff was nice and helpful with suggestions. Good spot, fam.
author: Keanu B.

description:
Quite possibly best sandwich ever!! 

How? Why? You may ask? 

Well.... What makes little deli stand out among the rest is the owners passion for food/cooking . The ingredients here are all fresh or housemade. This is no Oscar Meyer luncheon meat kinda place! It was my first time here so I needed a recommendation (which he was able to give without hesitation) 

After discussing all other options, I wanted it all!! However, I settled for one and went for the turkey lulu! This baby has fresh baked turkey, red cabbage slaw and WALNUT pesto. Add pepper jack cheese & Dutch crunch, and it's absolutely amazing. 

The care they put into making their sandwiches definitely shines through in it's taste! I devoured the whole thing while walking! Upon paying, I mistakenly was having activation problems with the only card I had on me and mistakenly forgot my wallet at home. I was so embarrassed!! The owner was completely lax about it and allowed to to pay him later; who does that nowadays?? This small deli with a warm community feel will continue to have MY business.
author: Angelina L.

description: I've never had a problem coming here to get a snack or a meal. The sandwiches are the best, hands down. I've been going here for quite some time now, so I've met the owner...he's fantastic!! Quite possibly one of the best owners ever--He is always around and making sure things are done right! I love to order the Rueben on rye bread with either type of meat. It's probably my favorite sandwich ever, and pair it with a crystal Pepsi since those are back for a limited time! They sell crystal Pepsi as well so it's a great place to get a quick meal. Another great quality is on any day (sunny ones preferred), you can walk up the block  and catch the N-Judah train to Ocean Beach!!
author: Maria L.

description: Being fairly new to San Francisco, and in need of good cheap eats that won't break the bank, Handy Deli has come up big in every way! Their sandwiches are on point and for the price ($8) it's hard to beat. The chicken salad is awesome, especially when it's made fresh. The owner is super nice and friendly and helpful, as well as the staff. They have a pretty healthy beer selection with good deals on local brews, and enough liquor to please (a bit pricey but normal for any liquor store trying to compete with the massive liquor outlets). I enjoy coming here, and will continue to frequent the Handy!
author: Matthew F.

description:
Handi sandwiches are my thing, and with tons of quality ingredients for around $5;  and 'value' is reason enough to pop by the deli, at Irving and 19th. 

Anyway, just beware the bold feeling of *savings* you get when buying stuff, since a fine selection of super-competitively priced beers, wines and unique spirits are like "right there" obviously.  One can easily spend a few bucks there, but it's O.K. They routinely check prices, deal with large quantities, etc. 

It is a real local enterprise, and the old building has been well kept under current management. I know nobody really "cares" about that, but it is actually historic, etc. - and Jerry did right by the location I think. 

So many necessary urban "extras" close at hand, with personal service, at dumb-ass "Big Mart" prices. Right. Where is the "love" button on this thing?
author: Mike S.

description:
I've been here for three separate reasons and I could give five stars for every separate criterion.

First I came here for wine and cheese. Let me tell you that their spirits collection is truly unbeatable -- there isn't a place that stocks as seriously as them. They have a decent wine and cheese selection, and I'll probably expire long before I try all of them. Four to five stars.

Second, I came here for snacks:chocolate, gummies, etc. Not only do they carry your ordinary American snacks, but they stock Haribo, and most importantly they stock Kinder and Ritter. Now you may not be familiar with German sweets, but in the Western Hemisphere no one really holds a candle to their craftsmanship. And these are the top selections. They stock quality. Five stars. My German friends endorse this view.

Third, I came here for a snack after a late workout. Now here I was skeptical -- I've had a lot of sandwiches, from Ike's to Hoagies to Deli Board to Sammys on 3rd, and the quality here is absolutely first tier. It may be better. Now I've only had a sandwich here once (today) and my roommate had a less good experience when they ran out of turkey, but this is what put the icing on the cake.

Now you know why this place is titled a delicatessen -- because it is quality food for the refined palette. Not a spirit shop, not a convenience shop, not a sandwich shop, but a purveyor of fine foods. I'm so impressed. A++.
author: Christophe C.

description:
Best chicken sandwich in town and such a good price!

I got the Frisco club for 5.95! It was massive, with delicious avocado and such good roast chicken.

My friend got the chicken shawarma which was also really good (I tasted both).

The service is very friendly. Jerry is the owner I think and he makes sure to give good recommendations.

Their wine selection is quite good for a small corner store as well.
author: Camille E.

description: I took a gamble stopping at this random deli as I drove thru SF and the gamble paid off big time. This place was amazing in terms of food quality and taste. I got the frisco club with chicken and the guy literally pulled chicken off the bone and put it on the sandwich. This was one of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. Price was right too.
author: John M.

description: My bf got the frisco club w/ chicken and provolone on dutch crunch, and I got the falafel wrap. Both were pretty cheap (total was $17, cheese is extra btw) and filling, but just decent in terms of taste and freshness. For his sandwich, the dutch crunch was a bit stale; for my wrap, I thought the falafel was dry and the tahini too liquidy.
author: Abby S.

description:
Holy shit Balls!! This place is the best. 

Can't actually believe i've not reviewed Jerry's (handy Deli) before. The owner, Jerry, is the greatest man operating an establishment in the the sunset period. 

They make pretty decent sammys for the money and all their booze is fairly priced or priced lower than the closer competitors. 

Go here if you're wondering about doing so. Just go. If you need a liquor store or a sandwich just do it. 

Note* Jerry might not be working unless its early in the day. Other champions include Wilmer or a 60 yrd man who is pretty quiet but equally nice.

Edit* I forgot about the Rotisserie CHicken! Dude this stuff is good. and not just for a little divey liquor store. I mean its good compared Pasíon on 9th. or some other restaurants with prices twice/ three times as high. Get it. definitely get it.
author: Rio V.

description: Expertly crafted sandwiches & salads, and a great selection of booze to boot. It's pretty amazing how many tasty things can be in this relatively small place. I just moved to the area and have already stopped in several times. That trend will continue.
author: Matt B.

description:
Forgot to mention! 
They also have an awesome German candy bar calls "haunt-Haselnutss-Schnitte" 
It's about 3"x3' square, half inch thick, two sandwich snack bar, hazelnuts chocolate between 2 wafers, $2.50

Great 8 inches long toasted submarine style L-size sandwich.
It's a large heavy juicy meaty sandwich.
So far, I had three of them in one week.

On March 24, Thursday, Hunter's Club Sandwich, medium-rare shaved roast beef, fresh lettuce, tomato, red onion and dijion mustard, 7 bucks.
But, after I ordered the Hunter's Club, I found a small sign menu on the glass counter, says "Pig Lover", I did not know that that is serve only on Thursday.

On March 25, Friday, 
So I came back next day, this day, Friday, try to get the 'Pig lover Sandwich', but the owner guy said, "That's Thursday Special. Only on Thursday. Come back next week!"
I was like wtf but, what can I do! So I had the Ruben in stead, w/ Pastrami, sauerkraut and thousand island dressing, 7 bucks.

On April 1st, Thursday, I came Back here to get the Pig!!! Pig lovers, Thursday Only deal, shaved roast pork, fresh lettuce, red onion and dijion mustard, $7.60 

I like heavy meaty sandwich.
I was like 'happy as a pig in a mud'.
I mean each single time.

It seems like a family own and operate deli.
People here were very nice. 
They have daily hot meal 'over-rice' specials for about 8 bucks.
author: Nobu K.

description: They have an awesome chicken sandwich ... but the house made baba ganoush is fabulous!! And they're nice peeps, to boot!
author: Helen T.

description:
This place is amazing. I thought I was going to hangout with friends tonight, so I looked up place with good beer prices on yelp. Long story short, when i was on my way, plans canceled. I decided to check it out anyway, and man was I impressed! The beer, liquor and wine selections are extensive and at great prices to boot! I picked up a 4 pack of "Milk Stout" by Widmer Brothers Brewing Co (which I had never tried).

The deli aspect of the store is about as legit as it gets. The sauces and meats are made there and are high quality. No canned anything involved! Everyday of the week they have a different fresh specialty (e.g. roasted turkey with mushroom gravy, home made  meatballs, clam chowder, etc). Most of their sandwiches are $7 for a full size and worth every penny. I ordered the "Turkey Lulu" and it was incredibly tasty.

As if quality products and great prices weren't enough to keep me coming back, the customer service was EXCELLENT. While I was waiting for my sandwich I had a great conversation with the owner, who is evidently passionate about what he does.

It's also worth mentioning that they carry my favorite cigarettes (Nat Sherman MCDs) which are not always easy to find (let alone at a decent price).

So after dropping in (without any solid intention of actually getting anything), Ieft with:

- 4 pack Milk Stout
- Turkey Lulu sandwich
- pack of Nat Sherms

Total: $22.90

This place is a new favorite. I will definitely be back.
author: Ericaceae S.

description: I'm not really a sandwich kind of guy. But this place is really the only to go place that I'd go for sandwiches. My favorites are Frisco club(chicken and bacon) and Hunter's club(roast beef). I'd never go to any place that doesn't use fresh ingredients... this place hasn't failed me yet!
author: Jay W.

description: This place is super friendly and awesome food! The portions are great even for my hungry boyfriend. Sandwiches are made fresh and really good value. There are always specials too. I love their breakfast sandwiches. They are really different from your typical offerings.
author: Kate H.

description: Everything on the deli menu is delicious but the Handy salad is amazing and big enough to be a meal. The salads and sandwiches are big and totally good value for the price. Jerry and staff are all super friendly and take pride in their food. Best deli yummies in SF!
author: Marisa L.

description: Beyond impressed,  came in for a midnight Sandwedge left missing living in the city. This place is beyond awesome and filled with trinkets and presents and things for those friends who have everything. I even noticed a crystal skull with some of the best looking  vodka in it I could ever imagine. Asked for a roast beef sandwich and got something the size of a very hefty Burrito...  I'll have a meal for now and for tomorrow! The owner is also an incredibly jovial nice guy with a smile that'll brighten up your day.
author: this b.

description:
This was my second order at Handy Deli and ordered ahead through yelp. Very seamless process, when I arrived my sandwich was just getting wrapped up. Took the sandwich and was out within a minute. As fast as it gets!
Delicious reuben sandwich with lot of mayo/mustard (if you are into it). Loved my lunch and will be back again.
author: Mayank S.

description:
I eat here every time I go on my lunch break. It's my favorite spot to get some food for pick up around this part of Irving. The house chicken is incredible and the staff are always delightful! They even know me by name now whenever I call in. :)
They also have a nice beer selection.
author: Sam S.

description: Here's  the deal! One of the top 5 sandwhich spots  I've  experienced! Nice  variety.FLAVORFUL Ruben  sandwich, what I like is food prep is open for viewing, owners are customer  focused, it reflects  in the finished  product. Will be back for the next  one (Chicken ,bacon & avacado). Try them out!
author: Ron P.

description: I recently stumbled across this place when we were starving and looking for food late at night while we were moving. What a find. Amazing sandwiches with fresh ingredients and homemade condiments. Really nice people too. Best bang for your buck in San Francisco.
author: Timothy G.

description:
Addicted to Turkey LuLu. 

Service is always friendly. Good value for a tasty sandwich near GGP.
author: daphne w.

description:
The boyfriend and I are new fans! We love the owner and his family, they're so cute. 

We decided to try it out one day since yelp kept saying nice things about Handy's. We instantly fell in love. It's not just sandwiches here, they have hot food too! The rosemary chicken is absolutely delicious. The daily specials are something everyone should try. All of the times that we've gotten it, we were always satisfied. 

The owner recognizes us too. Makes us feel special. (:

And quoting my boyfriend, "I love everything there."
author: Becca W.

description: They have great wine deals, also carry my favorite Biserna muscat grappa, delicious  foods and great service.
author: Vance P.

description:
Walking home one day I had a taste for a nice beer. Stopped in at Handy Deli for the first time and was wowed by the selection.  A year later I continue to be impressed by all the craft beers and look forward to always finding something new in their coolers.  

They make delicious fresh sandwiches to order that hit all my comfort food buttons. Their rosemary chicken made me a hero when I brought some home for dinner.  

Jerry the owner and his family are really nice. They treat their customers like friends, and give good suggestions on a beer or wine to try.  A great easy going neighborhood atmosphere.  I am glad I stopped in to buy a beer that day.
author: Kiam C.

description: This place is great. They are open almost always and have a high quality selection of food and beverages. The people that work there (the new blond guy and the pretty woman with small children) have been nothing but kind and informative. It feels like a local neighborhood corner store. Can't say enough positive things about this shop.
author: Jessica C.

description: Great staff and amazing hours! I love the new hot meals they offer during the day but the sandwiches are still amazing. They also have had some great sour beers come threw!
author: Sean G.

description: Excellent customer service! Every time I go in they stop what they're doing to help they don't make you wait. They're always gracious and polite.
author: Judy A.

description:
I have to apologize to Jerry and his wife Leila-- the owners of Handy Deli, for taking such a LONG TIME to write this review!( I should have written it a year ago!)

Handy Deli serves up some of the best quality sandwiches and hot food in the Sunset.  I work across the street and frequent Handy Deli almost once a week.  The service is EXTREMELY and GENUINELY friendly!  Jerry, his wife, Leila, their boys, Mohammed, are some of the sweetest and nicest people you'll ever meet!


Order their daily roast chicken plate.  Such a deal for the quality and quantity that you get! Their roast chicken is hot, flavorful, juicy, and tender!  It falls off the bone and goes great with their yummy rice (or roast potatoes), AND a generous side salad!  Lots of times (so I don't have to cook!) I would buy a couple of plates to take home for dinner.  They have other specials ( check their menu)-- "Thanksgiving Tuesday" (as I like to call it)-- slices of turkey with gravy and mashed potatoes, chicken cacciatore, pulled pork, meatballs, ... ALL YUM!!!!


Their sandwiches are equally yummy! Fresh and made to order!  My colleagues and ( even my own parents!) love going to Handy to get their Reuben sandwich!  I love the Hunter's Club (rare roast beef, lettuce, tomato, onion, mayo, mustard) -- Again... YUM!!!


Now, the other reason why I wanted to write this very belated review-- Handy Deli also CATERS!  Last year, I was hunting around for a caterer for my son's 1st birthday-- instead of going to a restaurant. I inquired with Jerry on a whim, and my husband and I are sooo glad that we did!  We went with Jerry and he did NOT disappoint!  He worked  and stayed within our budget, gave a variety of menu items to choose from.   And on the day of our son's party, he AND his wife, Leila, catered the whole event BY THEMSELVES.  They arrived at the venue promptly, prepped all of the food, served and cleaned up everything!  And poor Jerry is so accommodating and flexible-- there was another event that "shared" the venue's kitchen ( we weren't informed of this) and he worked around them.

Guests were served Handy's roast chicken and pulled pork, rice pilaf, roast potatoes, and roasted vegetables.

ALL of our guests raved about how DELICIOUS and plentiful the food was!!!


You cannot go wrong with HANDY!  Consider them to cater your next event, or if you are planning to go out for a picnic in the park, or to the ball park... call in an order for a couple of hot plates or freshly made sandwiches!  YOU CANNOT GO WRONG!!!

=)
author: Jenn T.

description: I've been going to this deli/liquor store for over a year now, so this review is way overdue!  Don't want to make this too long, so in a nutshell: surprisingly delicious sandwiches (my favorite is the roast beef - medium rare), fair or lower than average prices on liquor, and the best part is JERRY (owner of the store) is full of positive vibes!  He treats everyone like family, and his incredible customer service is what keeps me coming back to this particular shop.  Also, his beer recommendations never fail to impress my beer-snob of a boyfriend.  Jerry, you are the bestttt!!!
author: Janice L.

description:
no bueno for me.  on my to try list but wish i woulda went to lucca instead

guy making the sandwich was really nice though, just gave me the wrong sandwich after I thought we confirmed couple times the chickens nest ala egg salad.  get home it's chicken salad, #$#%!? was charged a buck less so the cashier got it right but damn a casualty of communication barrier

was thinkin about the sandwich the whole walk home, so had my mind set as the anxiety was kickin in too for the let down

although no biggie not gonna cry over spilled milk.  can change gears and taste buds pretty fast.  however it wasn't even that good, skimpy and dry.  it was 930 on a tuesday nite so maybe winding down

perhaps another time
author: Clark G.

description: Okay so I've now been a regular here for years. It's still amazing. The food that they make is super delicious (Turkey Lulu and Chicken Cardini Club Rock my wolkd). Their beer selection always has something new and great for me to try, and their entire staff is the best!
author: Tim S.

description: I have to say, I haven't been coming here long, but it is truly amazing. Their food is always delicious and consistent. The staff are some of the friendliest in the neighborhood. You couldn't ask for a better deli.
author: Chase B.

description:
I've never been here for a sandwich, but what these guys excel at is a great craft beer selection! They obviously have a smaller selection than, say, a fully stocked Whole Foods or City Beer Store, but for something in a convenience mart it's really good. What they lack in pure variety they make up for by having a lot of the rare one-off beers that a lot of breweries make seasonally.

4 stars just cause the beer prices are convenience store prices and not the best.
author: Josh K.

description: Try the shawarma sandwhichs.  Love the beef but chicken is also great. Make sure you ask for the home made hot sauce.
author: Patrick W.

description:
Great neighborhood store! Really nice owner and great employees. Elmer is awesome and makes delicious sandwiches. They just remodeled and have a new menu with more offerings. 
Perfect for late night grub - Sandos are bomb and made until 1 am I believe.
author: Kelly P.

description: I was surprised when I walked in because it's tucked into a convenience store. I ordered the Chicken Delight and it was delicious, especially since I had been walking around the Golden Gate Park for three hours. They put in a good amount of meat so don't worry about it. I didn't realize that they charge 0.75 for cheese but might as well while you're there. There are two small tables outside the deli so you can eat out there. It was nice to just sit outside and enjoy food.
author: Lola H.

description: My favourite deli sandwich comes from this place.  Incredible 'hard-to-find' selection of wines, beer, candy, you name it!  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Thanks for looking after my pal, Bob.
author: Lawree S.

description:
Huge sandwiches for a cheap price!
Amazingly good!
Take your meal and eat it on a sunny day in the Golden Gate Park!
author: Khaloud D.

description:
I've been here a couple times to buy alcohol. They have a nice selection of European chocolates and some pretty good drink selections. I can't speak for their food.

I am going to give them 2.5 stars because of an experience we had here tonight. My GF and I walked in to buy some wine, and one of the guys who was working there immediately came up and started to "sell" to  us. He was very pushy and we were very rushed to buy. I wanted to buy maybe two $8 bottles of wine, but he offered to sell us two $20 bottles for the price of one.

When we got to the checkout, our bill was at $25, and I told the cashier that he said he was going to sell us both bottles for $20, so he checked with the guy and agreed to knock off $3. The wines were pretty good and I did verify the MSRP of the bottle he said was $20 that sold for $7, so that was slightly redeeming...

The product and price were fair, but we didn't like being pressured to buy more than what we had planned on paying for.
author: P A U L.

description: So happy to have this spot in my neighborhood. I recently moved here, and I just discovered the great sandwiches and friendly service at this local spot. Even though I have just been in a few times now, the owner always recognizes me and greets me with a friendly smile. The sandwiches are top notch, especially for the price. Today I tried the chicken delight and was very satisfied. I am looking forward to many future visits!
author: Brian S.

description: On the outside it looks like a regular liquor store. On the inside, it's pure magic. First off everyone is really nice and welcoming. Second they have an amazing selection of sandwiches and rotisserie chicken. The chicken comes with saffron rice and a salad and I absolutely love it. If you sign up on the Belly app, you gain points for free stuff.  I really couldn't ask for more.
author: Sophia C.

description:
Handy indeed!

This place has an amazing selection (my bf never ceased to be amazed by the beer choices and prices) and the owner is a stand-up guy.

Their pastrami is the business, too.
author: Tamara S.

description:
This is the first store I visited when I moved into the neighborhood about three years ago, and it is still my go-to place for just about everything one would want from a corner store/deli. Jerry and his employees are friendly, knowledgeable and helpful, and if they don't have something in stock, Jerry will get it for you!

Prices are competitive, and snack items are well priced. Liquor, wine and beer are reasonable, and you can get some real deals for the sale items. The newest addition is a terrific deli, with really tasty sandwiches and fresh dishes. This is home-made food, and delicious.

I recommend the Handi Deli without reservation!
author: Steven A.

description:
So I exited Yancy's Saloon in search of a fine meal to sate my drunchies (granted I'm hardly trashed)... As I walked in, a fine fellow (Dan, he's got an epic beard..) offered to make m
e a bomb sandwich. Now, if someone decides to make a claim such as this, I'm immediately skeptical. Let me put this into perspective... This pastrami sandwich w/ lettuce, tomato, stone ground mustard AND Dijon mustard, cheese, and its all on a delicious soft roll... I cannot describe the amount of satisfaction I received. It's humanly impossible. Whenever you're around the Inner Sunset and are lookin for decently price alcohol and fant-freakin-tastic sandwiches, stop by Handy and give Dan the opportunity to make you pure homemade deliciousness.
author: Andrew N.

description: This is the best value in SF as far as alcohol sales go.  The sandwiches are top notch to boot.  Jerry is one of the nicest guys you will ever meet.  I have used Handy Deli for a few large catering events and my guests were all very happy with the freshness and creativity of the sandwiches and sides.  I get the chicken plate every time I can and it is the best deal in the city.  A quarter of a chicken, huge fresh salad, and a big pile of tasty rice.  Trumer is always 5.99 a six pack.  Great wines.  Great value.
author: Johnny B.

description: Super awesome neighborhood digs, Jerry and his family are great, and the sandwiches and beer selection here are equally awesome. Not to mention the plethora of Ritter Sport always hanging out by the counter (Knusperflakes represent!).
author: Preston G.

description: Best deli I've been to in the city. Delicious sandwiches prepared right in front of you. Speedy service. Friendly staff. This is the first place I take friends for a quick meal, especially when we're trying to fight off a hangover. Highly recommended the "skinny," it's my favorite sandwich and always hits the spot.
author: Tyson R.

description: This place is very friendly! I came all the way from Burbank to try this out. I was not disappointed at all. Really good food. I would definitely come back again!
author: Lukas M.

description:
This place is exactly what a neighborhood liquor store should be:

- Friendly owner and employees who will engage in conversation when you look like you're in a good mood( and let you pass by when you look like you aren't). Not to mention if you come in often enough, they'll usually start recognizing you as a regular.

- Superb deli sandwich setup. Got a lot of good quality deli meats and cheeses, and also have the mobile app GoPayGo setup so you can order a sandwich online a few minutes before so you pick it up on time.

- Good selection of beer, snacks, ice cream, liquor, wine. Most things you'd need from a liquor store are here.

- Open late.
author: Brendan L.

description:
This is a review for Handy Deli as a liquor store and not a sandwich shop. 

I will certainly echo the sentiment that this deli has a great array of craft beers, both in six-packs and large bottles. 

What I cannot echo are the reviews that claim that their prices are "not the best," or that they "charge way too much for some of their beers."

I am not sure what kind of alternative beer universe these folks are living in, but Handy has the best prices I have found in the city for microbrews (and I have looked, believe me). Sixes of Trumer Pils and Bridgeport - $5.99! Sierra Nevada (not just the Pale Ale but their other offerings as well, including their amazing Kellerweis Hefeweizen), Deschutes, Kona, Widmer Brothers, among others - $6.99! Lagunitas, New Belgium, Speakeasy, among others -  $7.99! 

Not only are their prices the lowest around (including Lucca down the street, which has a credit card minimum - Handy does not), the guys who work there are extremely nice and happy to have a chat with you about the state of microbrew retail. And, if you go often enough, they'll know what you like and offer suggestions, and even give you a free bottle or two of something else to try. The owner in particular has given me some great recommendations for new stuff to try. My beer $ is going to them as long as I live in the Sunset.
author: David G.

description: Don't be deceived by the outside...this deli is a hidden gem! Best chicken shawarma around. The sandwiches are fresh, hot, and delicious. I was surprised at their awesome beer and wine selection as well. All reasonably priced. The owner is super friendly and helpful!
author: Laura M.

description:
I have been going to Handy Delicatessen occasionally for a number of years and every time I stop by the owners and staff are warm and welcoming. I feel I am among family there. They are very knowledgeable and accommodating. 

One day I was digging through the refrigerated cheese and packaged meat case and the young man who works there asked me if he could help. I told him I was looking for sliced American cheese. He looked for me and we both came to the conclusion that they where out. He then said I can buy freshly sliced American cheese from the deli counter. I am so glad I accepted his offer. The cheese was incredible and much better than the typical packaged cheese. Plus it was a decent price. I believe I paid about $5.00 for a lb. and at Safeway they charge $7.00. 

They have an incredible selection of beer, Allagash being my favorite. Also, they have Skinny Girl Margarita! The only store in the entire Sunset district to carry it! The owner will brag about it, but that only means he is very proud of his business and he cares to please his customers. 

This will continue to be my go-to spot. I do support the other stores nearby, but if I buy too much alcohol I feel they judge me. Not Handy Deli! I bought a bottle of Skinny Girl Margarita today and asked the Owners (nice young couple) to help me get a small bottle of tequila because the Skinny Girl was not strong enough, that's why it's skinny ;) The husband offered a nice bottle of tequila but it was above my price range. Then he offered a larger bottle of similar price but if I keep a large bottle, I will drink too much. The wife picked up on that! She said maybe it's better to have a little so it's not around. Yes! Great people, they really will accommodate you. The husband then found the perfect little bottle for me. Sold! 

Everything is right on spot here, I don't know why I would go anywhere else.
author: Yasmin E.

description: Fantastic everything. The worker was extremely friendly and helpful. The food was so delicious. I definitely want to make my way back here soon.
author: Tjae T.

description:
This guy has a great liquor, beer and wine selection.  A tallboy of budweiser is hands down the cheapest price in the city @ $1.50 out the door, and there are a few other deals like that if you poke around (or ask the owner!).  According to him, they are revamping the "deli section" and will start offering a more gourmet selection of sandwiches and other things like meatloaf and lasagna.  I've had a few sandwiches which have varied in quality, though I have to say one time it was the best salami with smoked cheddar sammy I had in years!

The owner (you can see him with arms folded in the main picture above) works mostly during the daytime on weekdays, and while the other guys working there are all cool ppl, the owner is the best to talk to for recommendations (and he also seems to make the best sandwiches).

Bottom line is the prices,selection and friendly/efficient service makes this place an easy five stars!  I'm so blessed to live a block and a half from here!
author: Alex L.

description:
Review is for the booze, not the sandwiches... 

Looking for a local craft beer shop in the sunset? This place has got you pretty well covered! The workers there are super friendly and I always feel right at home now whenever I walk in. They do encourage you toward certain deals here and there but heck, they're just being friendly and making sure you have a good time for whatever purposes your purchase will be for! No harm in that! There is no single statement about the prices; some are a little high, some are pretty damn reasonable just depends what you're getting. Sometimes the guys are even willing to cut you a deal so can't hurt to ask! 

Just one star off because their selection isn't quite as extensive as I would have loved but hey, its a great neighborhood liquor store. 

[for you craft beer heads out there: they unfortunately do not carry russian river. They did have plenty of Deschutes Abyss last month but I believe they are sold out now. $7 for six pack of mirror pond/black butte/ etc.]
author: Chris D.

description:
O-M-F-G I wish my tolerance and wallet was bigger... this place is an alcoholic's disneyland.  So, kind of a funny/strange story of how I ended up here...so here goes:

While checking out an apt., Jai (Mr. Awesome-o) mentioned sip-able tequila...and my noob friend (name has 5 letters and starts with H) explained how another friend of ours was in disbelief of this legendary sip-able tequila.  So to prove this magical tequila exists, Jai took us to the corner of 19th and Irving, where this small (only from the outside!!), easy-to-miss, deli/liquor store is located.  The store owner, Jerry greeted Jai with a hi5 and big smile, waving to the new entourage Jai brought along with him.  Felt like i was on an episode of Cheers!  ... except in a liquor store...super friendly and welcoming  :)

EVERY INCH of the wall behind and along the counter is stashed with liquor....and in the corner shined a blue and gold box with the name "Oro Azul" dazzling in all its sip-able glory.  This place is LOADED...literally!!  There's a bottle in the shape of a machine gun on the front window display...!!  I've never seen so many uniquely shaped bottles for te-kill-ya!  Jerry was nice enough to show us around and chat.  There's a wide range of liquor, snacks, and deli food.  It's rare to see a liquor store that's maintained so well; clean, well-stocked, and the friendliest people.

All I can say is...I'll definately be back and I'll be expecting my hi5 from Jerry.  :)  AND someday I'll get me some of that sip-able tequila (which I'll probs be sippin for days cause it's $150+)
author: Kat C.

description: The Handy Deli is hand down the most convenient liquor store in the Sunset District of San Francisco! I come to this liquor store at least 3 times a day and I am never disappointed. The business is family run so it is all love and the employees show it. Thanks Handy Deli.
author: Stevie M.

description:
Jerry's Handy Deli now offers complete meals, and they are superb. This is the place for dinner, or lunch take out. There are tables outside.
Today, the rosemary chicken with saffron rice was excellent.  I also had roasted potatoes that were great.
The salad with a perfect 'secret' dressing is julienned as rarely seen these days in fine dining establishments. I kid you not, this is dinner party take-out that will please every guest.
Jerry was roasting turkeys while I was there and they smelled (and looked) amazing.
I purchased lasagna for my guest, and she loved it !!! 
Jerry topped the lasagna with freshly grated parmesan. The garlic bread was the best I have had in a restaurant, and I make it all the time. 
I might add that the prices are so reasonable, especially considering the ingredient(s) quality. These foods are very labor and love intensive, as well as large portions.   
Everything that comes across the counter is the best in San Francisco. Jerry is a must meet guy.
-ts-
author: Tex S.

description: Ordered a chicken shawarma sandwich and I'm thinking dreaming of it three days later...
author: Crystal L.

description:
Handy Deli is awesome.  Jerry, the owner, is so friendly and stocks the place with the best selection of wine and beer in this area of The City.  He has wines from $7.00 to $100 and up.  His beer selection is HUGE.  

The deli just stared a hot food service that is THE BOMB!  The chicken is fall off the bone delicious.  My kids were arguing over who gets the last few bites.  

Great neighborhood store!!
author: Katie B.

description: One of the worst things about my boyfriend's move out of the Sunset was that we lost access to a place like Handy's. This deli is so rad. The people are super sweet and friendly, yet able to deal with the characters that sometimes wander through their doors. They can also make a mean sandwich. The selection is also great, including hard-to-find specialty drinks, imported candy, and all your favorite spirits and wines. Rate$ are a tad high, but hey -- that's the price you pay for convenience at any liquor store. We recently re-visited the place and it's only gotten better post-remodeling. If only Handy would open up another location in my 'hood..!
author: Julie D.

description: Best liquor store in sf. Great deals, selection, and new products. Also try the new deli food. Its amazing. This is my go-to liquor store for all my boozing needs. They are friendly and treat you like family.
author: Jake C.

description: Jerry and Elmer are my boys! They reward loyal customers by ordering the beer we like and giving us free sandwiches and other goodies. Especially love their service anytime there's an event in the park. Theyre just pumped and hoping people have a good time In their neighborhood. Even ordered a keg from them for a party and the price and service was 100% better than Bevmo wouldve been. Great employees, wide selection, reasonable prices, sandwiches, coffee, even bagels. Handy deli over Lucca foods any day!
author: Jeremy H.

description: Their sandwiches are amongst the best I've ever had.  Their weekly special pork lovers sandwich is exceptional, I encourage this reader to try it.  You'll likely be dreaming of it that night and wanting it again the following week.  The owner and wife team treat you like royalty.
author: Leslie F.

description:
Five stars?  Really?  I obviously went on an off day, because the sandwiches I got were below average.  

First off, I actually WROTE DOWN exactly what I wanted on my sandwiches, and the guy who was making them kept asking me if I wanted various things that I hadn't written down, specifically MUSTARD.  I hate mustard on my sandwiches.  When I got home and unwrapped my sandwich, lo and behold!  MUSTARD.  Also, he asked if I wanted peppers, and I said no, and the sis-in-law got PEPPERS on hers.  That was the one thing she specifically told me she didn't want.  Come on, dude!  I wrote it down!

Aside from getting stuff we didn't want on our sandwiches, there really wasn't anything special about them.  My ciabatta bread was pretty dry and the bacon was rubbery.  

I really hate being the one reviewer to not give a place a glowing review, but I was so disappointed!  They only got two stars because service was friendly and it was cheap.
author: Eileen H.

description:
Great sandwiches at a great price. They have so many different meats to choose from, on four or five kinds of bread, and if you come before 4 p.m. you can get a bag of chips and can of soda for only 50 cents more. 

They also sell glass bottle sodas and candy from around the world.  

It's pretty easy to see why this is the top place that comes up in a Yelp search for highest rated and most inexpensive. 

The parking on Irving is insane. Every few yards there's someone double-parked and the spaces are scarce. Had to park several blocks down, after pumping a couple bucks into the meter to get an hour, so we could run down to Handy for some mortadella on a French roll goodness.
author: Christine A.

description: Sixers of Trumer are $5.99 +tax, need I say more?  Ok fine, I will.  You can find great prices for just about anything alcoholic and snack related here.  The owner Jerry is a great guy, always friendly, always interested in feedback about his place.  They recently added hand made sandwiches but my favorite is their roast chicken w/ jasmine rice and roasted veggies or salad.  The chicken is juicy, the rice fluffy, and the vegetables tender and buttery.  There is love in that food!  I live down the street, it's about the best corner store deli I've seen.
author: Will B.

description:
I LOVE Handy Deli! It is my neighborhood deli/liquor store of choice.
Aside from having all the choices you could need at a reasonable price, the owner is great. 
Jerry is my favorite. We have gotten to know him so well over the last couple of years.
He never lets us down. He always asks how we're doing and will always let us in to use the restroom if we're romping around the neighborhood.
One time I stopped by there before my friend's birthday party (Jerry knows her too) and Jerry told me to wish her a Happy Birthday from him and then handed me a bottle of champagne to give to her.
This place is great. Don't go anywhere else in neighborhood. Handy Deli all the way.
author: Rose S.

description:
A countdown in honor of 2010:

5: In stars, the number I'm happily awarding for one of the best sandwich experiences I've had. Apparently I'm not the only yelper who feels this way.

4: In dollars, the cost of my very reasonably priced sandwich.

3: In pounds (at least that is what it felt like) of turkey and veggies crammed between two slices of sourdough. Epically delicious.

2: In minutes, the time it took the super friendly guy to make my sandwich. Incredibly fast.

1: Rank of my new year celebration, which included the unbelievable Above & Beyond at 1015 Folsom. This incredible sandwich totally complemented the perfect start to the year.
author: Jason B.

description:
This store has some of the best customer service you will find ANYWHERE. The owner gets it. Certainly the best place to go in the neighborhood and without a doubt the only place I'll buy alcohol. I have yet to buy a sandwich here, but I will. 

A friend from out of town once commented: "Wow, you can tell that guy is really proud of his store." I agreed.
author: Ryan A.

description: No frills... just good sandwiches at very decent prices ($4.50-7.00). It would have been 5-stars except that I got a tummy ache coincidentally... I'm not going to assume it was the sandwich's fault.
author: Stephen Y.

description: great spot in the neighborhood. there is a large selection of alcohol and other beverages, and snacks. the deli is super fresh and has great and wholesome food. been coming here for years and they've definitely improved over time!
author: Ale x.

description:
It's a blast having these guys in the neighborhood. All the folks who work here get a big thumbs up. Every time I order at the deli counter (which is pretty often) they throw in an extra piece of dolmas, or another falafel, or a little extra hummus... Yum! 

Oh, and their deviled eggs are delish! (But don't try to get them late at night! They usually sell out by 8p.)
author: Candy C.

description:
Ok, Let me start by saying this doesn't trump my original review. I do still love this place. Always friendly service and great prices and selection. 

Hopefully this was an isolated incident, but my roommate picked up sandwiches for us tonight and not so much. He said it wasn't Felix or any of the guys we had seen before. When he told my he was there, I sent him a text saying exactly what I wanted on my sandwich: Turkey, jack cheese, mayo, avocado, salt and pepper. Yeah, I know, I like my stuff pretty plain. Apparently, my roomie told him what I wanted AND showed him the text. 

When he returned with the sandwiches, both of our sandwiches were waaaay skimpier than usual. Barely any turkey on either, the toppings weren't distributed properly. My buddy's sandwich had pickles, the one thing he specifically asked to be left off. Mine had lettuce and tomato and pickles. Wasn't that big of a deal, but it was almost as messed up as it could have been. 

Anyway, I'll still definitely come back because I think this was just the sunday night guy that's not as good.
author: Parker H.

description: A great place to buy brews and ales that are often hard to find in other locations.
author: Billy C.

description: So far this place gets five stars from me for having an out of this world beer selection. Picked up a Stone 11 Vertical Epic  from here today and can't wait to stop by again to browse their amazing selection of brews.
author: Ericka A.

description: Come very often to browse their beer selection and the prices are great! Craft brew selection is awesome and its located right before the golden gate park. Making this place a mandatory stop. My roommate has had their sandwiches and say that they are solid. All of the different staff members are helpful and super nice.
author: Zachery H.

description:
I'll put it to you like this. I always turn to the masses of Yelp for advice on local SF spots, but never felt it necessary to create an account until now.

I'm been going to this deli for 4 years. And it was pretty cool. And then the new owner Jerry (and his family) bought the place and it became f&#*ing awesome!  

Jerry and I have an intrinsic relationship. He sells alcohol, and I buy it. He's super friendly, everybody loves him, completely non-judgemental, and has even found a week to not be overpriced on beers (a common pitfall of local liquor store who can't compete with the major stores).

He always has at least a few good deals on Microbrews (right now Chang (Thai beer), and Bridgeport Ebenezer Ale are my flavors of the week. And his liquor and wine selections are on point too.

His family is friendly and his son is hilarious (I have cell phone video of the two of them breaking into dance in the middle of the store). He even invited his customers to his birthday party, where we danced all night.

In short, of all the future reviews I will do from here on out (now that I have an account, I feel the itch), this is likely to be the only one with this level of praise. 

And since I go out of my way to have my friends also shop at his store whenever they can, Yelp is the logical next best step!

p.s. Here's a tip. Ask him to play a song for you. He's never afraid to crank up a cool dj tune!
author: Josh H.

description:
I love this place, bought my first legal beer here actually. 
- Decent selection of beer and alcohol, not too extensive but they're guaranteed to have something you'll like.
- Delicious sandwiches.  I usually get the turkey with smoked cheddar on dutch crunch. The pastrami is awesome too.
- Very nice staff, the owner recognizes me as a regular and is always very nice and hooks me up with a big portion of meat when I get a sandwich
- Great prices, way better than most liquor stores I go to in the city.

Honestly, what more can you ask for?
author: Daniel C.

description:
I find myself trying out more sandwich places these days. Sometimes, it gets hard to distinguish the sandwich between different delis. 

Handy Delicatessen finds itself sticking out from your typical deli. One, it's cheap. I paid $5 for a roast turkey sandwich on a French roll. Two, the bread is fresh. They use the Boudin brand, which definitely enhances the eating experience. The turkey meat is decent and is balanced by the mayonnaise flavor. Three, service is fabulous. The people working behind the counter are very chill and laid back. 

Overall, you don't really pay for what you get here. You get more than that. I'm very pleased by the quality of the sandwich and more so by the service. 4 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Best beer prices in town plus owner is very helpful and friendly. Trummer at $6.00 a six pack!!! Such a deal!!!!
author: Adam G.

description:
Handy Deli is the BEST. I love going to this place to grab a sandwich. The owner Jerry always remembers me and my veggie sandwich order...which is always delicious. My friends who have gotten meat sandwiches also said they were great. Also, excellent hummus and dolmas!

Not to mention the ridiculous selection of beer and liquor. They have EVERYTHING and at great prices.

Basically, Lucca's down the block may have a more snazzy looking sandwich board, but their sambos are MUCH more expensive and nothing special. I thoroughly enjoy going to the Handy Deli every week!
author: Jenna J.

description: I had a HUGE craving for a turkey avocado swiss cheese sandwhich on sourdough bread at 1:30 in the morning! Don't ask me why ( I dreamt about eating that sandwich the night before) but I had to have it and yelped this place. The sandwhich definitely did not disappoint. Add chips and a ice cold coke to the mix and I was one happy camper.
author: Yennie N.

description:
If you're in need of a sandwich in this neighborhood, skip over this place. Tried the deli a couple times at Handy's and have come up pretty disappointed. Too bready, skimpy, and meat quality can be a bit sketch sometimes in the deli case.
