There's also a great chance that your order will only be half right and haven't had an employee yet who seems to care about finishing my order in a timely manner. Yes, the sandwiches are cheap, but you certainly pay for what you get here.

They carry the very very basics (I head down the street to Lucca on the corner when I need the snacks, basics, etc.), but it's more of a beer/liquor stop that seems to attract the underage crowd. Used to live right next to Handy's and had to have the unfortunate daily walk through the underage smoking crowd bumming off of exiting customers. Don't get me started about the kids who ask you to buy them beer and look like they're 14. So annoying! Don't these people have a responsibility to report these kiddos or at least shoo them off?!

Over the years this place has gone from average to kinda ghetto. Disappointing to see it decline.
author: Jenna Y.

description:
I love Handy. I've been coming here for years for alcohol and munchies, and have always had amazing experiences. Super friendly service, and I always feel like among friends or family when I come in.

I remember New Years a couple years back, I hadn't been in for a few months and the owner (sorry, I can't recall your name!!!) recognized me right off the bat! He greeted me with a warm welcome and we engaged in conversation for a bit. As I was checking out, he gave me a bunch of free stuff, shoving those small travelers bottles of gin and vodka and even some smokes.

This is best liquor store in the entire City, hands down.
author: Mace M.

description:
Great friendly neighborhood liquor store. The new-ish owner, Jerry, has really turned the store around and it's clean, well-maintained and friendly. They have some great specials on beer and wine and have started getting into harder-to-find and limited release bottles. 

There are a lot of crappy liquors stores in SF, so Handy is a definitely a breath of fresh air.
author: Brandon B.

description: This place is great! I was in a pinch and needed to get brunch delivered to my office. With short notice Jerry came to my work and catered an entire meeting for 65 people. Jerry and his family went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect and everybody loved the variety of sandwiches :) We will definitely have them back soon!
author: Kitty B.

description:
A few days ago, around midnight, I started my car and it stalled as soon as I got to a stop sign. It started back up again but I pulled over in front of the Handy Liquor store to check my oil, because the area was well lit and there was a parking stall in front. 

I was amazed by how two guys from Handy Deli (or Handy Liquors, as I think of it) rushed right out to help me as soon as they saw me pop my hood. One guy's name was Edgardo and unfortunately I didn't catch the other guy's name but - they were awesome. It was SO nice to have those guys offer their help. I know I would have been able to do most of the stuff on my own (checking the oil and adding a quart) but it was sure sweet to see their willingness to help!  Nothing sucks quite like car trouble and that feeling of vulnerability that goes along with it when you have no idea what the hell to do to fix it. 

One guy shined his cell phone light on the little hole where you're supposed to put the dipstick back in (even with the bright store light it was a little hard to see) and one guy poured the oil... then when a little spilled the guy with the cell phone wanted to help wipe it up. How about that!

I've gotten beer and a few other things from this place before. Far as I can tell it seems to be your average liquor store but MAN they got some good guys working there!  I wish more people were like this.
author: Laura S.

description: The Deli is right next door to where I work. My company does Friday lunch catering with them. They charge us $100 for 3-4 big trays of delicious sandwiches, one tray of devil eggs, a platter of cheese & crackers and various sodas. Everytime I go in there, the guys always hook me up. Be sure to try their devil eggs and their roast beef on dutch crunch. Jiries is the owner and he's awesome!
author: Christina K.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!  Great prices and a great alcohol selection (especially for the beer).  Sandwiches are great and very fairly priced (you can get a pretty large sandwich for around $5).  The owner is one of the nicest local business owners I've met in the city and is always in a good mood.  He gets to know the locals and even remembered I had been in Europe for a few weeks and asked how the trip went.  Highly recommend this place.
author: Pony S.

description: Love this place!!!!!!!!!!!! Best prices in San Francisco on anything he has in the store. Jerry is the nicest and most honest guy I have ever met.
author: Whisky T.

description: Took home some lasagna for dinner because it looked so good.  It tasted better than it looked.  Portions were huge so I'm going to enjoy the rest tomorrow!  Monday's special is Lasagna -- Get there early, I can't believe how delicious this was. I'll be back.   FYI, I hear Meatball Sunday is very popular here.  Huge wine section, too.  This is a deli near Golden Gate Park..  Sunday in the Park and Meatball Sandwich..sounds like a plan!
author: geo o.

description:
Wow. I had no idea this place was that great of a place. We were looking for a late snack at a friends house on 25th and he told us of a sweet place across GG park. 
So we ventured and found our way to this spot by foot, which was a long walk. But man, this place was great.
I only cared about filling my craving with a Turkey sanwich and drink, as well as a yoohoo. 
Ever since that night, its been my mission to find out where exactly I was so i could go back on my next night out in that area.
author: Tomás O.

description: hands down the best deli i have found in san francisco.
author: Elijah H.

description:
Beer selection: 5 stars for a local neighborhood liquor store.  They've got a handful of brews here that I can't find at bevmo. 

Beer prices: 2 stars.  They charge way too much for some of their beers.  I find slightly better prices and a similar selection at Lucca just next door.

Sandwiches: 2 stars.  I really don't understand why anyone would order a sandwich here.  

It took at least 10 minutes for each sandwich this guy made (simple, cold turkey and salami sandwiches), and he ignored other customers who needed to make small purchases.  I watched two other customers just give up and leave.  

He also messed up my order after asking what I wanted on it repeatedly.  

The sandwich itself was pretty lousy-- I could make something better at home in a fraction of the time.
author: John D.

description:
I heart this place. This is the secret place my friends and I used to go to to try and get people to buy us alcohol. And now 3 years after I'm actually able to do so myself, I keep coming back.

Jerry always remembers me! His little son is the cutest thing in the world and somehow I always get suckered into whatever special they're having at the moment. Everything is "just delievered!" "Special just started today!" haha.  I'm a sucker for this kind of special for you marketing and Jerry is a king at what he does. "well of course I want a Giant bottle of tequila with shot glass included!...why wouldn't I want that?! AND its on special!!! Jesus this day was made for me!"

Even when he's not working their whole staff is really great. They know about their alcohol and got me hooked on this pear beer stuff. Something I never would have picked up and tried myself thats for freaking sure, haha. 

Anywho, get your ass out to Handy Deli! It'll get you drunk and you'll always feel like you're part of the family over there. They're simply the BEST! BETTER THAN ALL THE RESSST! lol, yeah...just go there.
author: Sarah L.

description: Handy deli is awesome.  The owner and staff, especially Elmer are great. Their cheesesteak sandwich and shawerma has me coming by at least 3-4 times a week.  They also have great daily specials for lunch.  All the food is freshly prepared with fresh ingredients.  Best part is you can get a toasted sandwich all night long.
author: Karan G.

description: These guys are known for hooking a brother up! Last time I went I got a free bag of chips and he didn't charge me for my avo & cheese add-ons. These guys rule and are always very friendly. They also have a great, decently priced beer selection so don't forget to wash your sandwich down with some Stone or Prohibition brew.
author: Katie S.

description:
UPDATE:
Just got a turkey sandwich. Very yummy. Mine is cheese free and not toasted, but it's definitely a good sandwich, especially for around $4. I love that I just paid almost half what I'd pay for the same sandwich at Andronico's. Will be going back. Yay. :-) Sandwiches. Close to my house. Happy me! 

Also - I have to say again, how nice the owners are at this place! Husband and wife are usually in here together and today they had their little boy there too (who was friendly and adorable when he saw my little girl). 
I haven't tried the sandwiches here yet, although now I'm going to have to after reading other good reviews. I went in on Mother's day this year looking for a good bottle of wine and the owner (I think) was so nice! He and his really cute wife (they look so young) were incredibly friendly and helpful and made good conversation (and also totally made me feel awesome by saying they couldn't believe I was a mom because - oh! you look so young! - and totally the way to a woman's heart is flattery, right?). :-)

Anyway - will go and try sammich tomorrow - or monday - or soon - and update review.

I'm always happy to find nice local businesses that offer food that won't poison me. ;-)
author: Laura G.

description:
Jerry understands what the people want and is delivering in style. Affordable, reasonable prices for exceptional food! What kind of deli is open until 2am?!? Delicious bread (check), high quality meats (check), fresh veggies (check), melt in your mouth cheese (check) and scrumptious cheesecake for desert (CHECK!)  I have very little to critique, other than a suggestion for Jerry to consider adding a sauce of some kind (Italian dressing, spicy remoulade etc) to the sandwiches. 

A great business run by a man, Jerry, who understands the importance of good customer service and good product in order to compile a genuine business!!  Keep doing your thing
author: Matt D.

description: My response to all this talk of poor sandwiches for this place is.... They sell sandwiches? But anyway I go there for the liquor. I mean I can get good beer anywhere but this place always gives me a good deal on liquor. Some stuff I can get cheaper elsewhere, some stuff is priced much better, some stuff you can't find elsewhere. Hit or miss it's worth going if you go there.
author: Nicholas J.

description: I've been going here for years and the workers are really nice. I haven't gone here in a while but I remember this older guy being really friendly and he always remembered who I was and was very nice. Lots of booze and yummy sammys
author: Karen T.

description:
the owner was sooooo swt. he hooked it up with 2 bags of chips! as usual their sandwiches tastes delish!! YAAAAAY!!

nom nom nom!!
author: Valerie N.

description:
best deli everrrr.

cheap sandwiches--BLT for 4 bucks?  yes please!  they're big, and they offer dutch crunch bread, which is always awesome.  
they sell pierogis and piroshkis too. (not sure about spelling?  my bad.)
they also sell salami and cheese, and some type of loaf bread sometimes.
they've got the basic snacky-type items that most delis/gas stations have, but it's their alcohol selection that makes them really notable.  
they have everything.  EVERYTHING.  and decent prices too.  
everything in the store was clearly labeled too, which i appreciate.
some of the employees are really nice guys, and gave my friend and i free chocolate and extra sandwich ingredients for free  :D

i will be back!!
author: Allison B.

description: I live right down the street so I'm always running in here to get sodas, kombucha, munchies. Nice dudes, too! Not to mention the EPIC selection of alcohol. Looking for vodka in a machine gun shaped bottle? This is the place.
author: Chloe C.

description: Great,Hidden Gem.Fantastic wine and beer selection...and Jerry the owner should be given a medal for his Amazing customer service-he rocks!!!
author: james m.

description: Good sandwich at a great price. Also, the guy at the counter was very nice. Nothing spectacular though.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Handy is right.  Lucca with its magic Italian name may get all the attention on this block, but just a couple doors down you can get an equally good sandwich (not on the legendary par of George's Zoo Deli or Roxie's, but still), and that beer selection is fantastic.  Normally I don't shop at "corner" liquor stores, but here it seemed that every California microbrew I've seen in my NorCal years had been reprised for my shopping pleasure, and at consistently low prices that make you want to grab just...one...more.  Throw in some customer service that keeps it real (they even gave me a free bottle to make up for having a sign advertising some no-longer-in-stock beer), and this block of Irving has earned a top place in my "where to buy beer" brain folder.
author: Wes M.

description: Best beer selection and deals in SF, i usually come here at least once a week and the owner is awesome!
author: Nana P.

description: If you're a beer lover you might like this place, I know I do.  They have a great variety of bombers and they make sure to pop some new ones in very consistently.  Last time I was in here they had five different Stone bombers alone, and they always have deals on their six-packs.  The guys who work here are all nice and I'm happy I live close by.  I'd give them five stars if it weren't for the high prices on some of the bombers.  I'm going to pop open my Sublimely Self-Righteous Ale and then maybe check out the new imperial IPA I saw there the other day!  Cheers.
author: Taylor A.

description: I've been thinking about joining yelp for awhile and this place was my motivation.  Super friendly customer service, great prices on a wide variety of beer, and a club sandwich that I inhaled in 5.2 seconds.  What more can a girl ask for?
author: Beth J.

description: My favorite deli right now, can't beat it esp with all the beer and booze to choose from
author: Thom E.

description: Handy Deli! One of the best liquor stores I've ever been to, not only because of the service, but because their sandwiches are amazingly great and cheap (good since I'm a student and all). Jerry (the store owner) is amazing and he'll help you with anything from picking alcohol to what kind of bread is the best for your sandwich. Everyone in Jerry's staff is friendly and just as welcoming as him. Another thing that is my FAVORITE about this liquor store/deli is their selection of international chocolates and their homemade deviled eggs. Yummiee stuffff! Highly recommended (both chocolates and deviled eggs). The store is also really convienent to get to because it is right off 19th Ave. and Irving, just take the 28 bus. Love Jerry, love the staff, love the food, looove Handy Deli. Get over there now!
author: Natalie D.

description: Handy Deli is hands down the best store in sunset. Jerry alone makes this the best place to go to in San Francisco. Such good deals!
author: Jesse R.

description: Jerry is the man!!  He is the guy to go to for any the best deli sandwiches, best selection of beer and wine, and for just good old advice.  I look forward to getting off work and stopping by on my way home.  A ton of cool characters work and hang out there which adds to the fun of stopping in.  If you live in the area this is the place to go for food and party supplies.
author: Christopher H.

description: I love this place! We're new to the neighborhood and we stopped by to pick up a couple of beers and were greeted by the super nice owner. He gave us coupons for sandwiches and recommended an awesome beer. As we were leaving he even gave us a free bottle to try. Now every time we have friends over, we go down there and get snacks and booze and they are always really friendly! Also, they have such a wide variety of unusual things and candy from all over the world....even Kinder specialties!
author: Nicole D.

description: This is my new place to buy beer, a great selection and it's cheaper than any of the other stores around since a recent change in ownership.  The new owner is great.  He is very friendly and already knows my name.  He has cleaned up the joint and has rearranged the shelves so there is more space to walk.  Overall a much better place to shop.
author: MJ E.

description: Do not count on this place at last call. Closes early frequently prior to 1:30AM. Higher prices then anywhere in the Sunset.
author: Enoch K.

description: This place is awesome. They always have great deals on wine and beer not to mention killer sandwiches. Jerry, the owner is the nicest person I've met in a while. Everyone should go there before they go to any other liqour store.
author: Ruth R.

description: This place is key to my survival. The sandwiches are delicious, made on Boudin bread! Nicest staff ever and best prices in town.
author: Mathius C.

description:
This place is a beer drinkers palace. All the best for brews for unheard of prices. Anderson Vally, Mendocino and hard to find Belgians for at cost prices.
Jerry was very helpful and knows his stuff. 
This is a-must stop for any events in the park. My new favorite packy!!
author: Jay W.

description:
nicest people, best prices and probably about the best beer selection anywhere around!
love this place.
author: Bill K.

description: This place is my late nite spot.  Service is always top notch and the sandwiches are tasty for a great price!  I don't know of another place where such attention is payed to the making of my sandwich--and that is a BIG plus for me.  Thanks for the late nite food and beers!!!
author: kyle v.

description: My friend and I took a Sunday afternoon jaunt here purely because it was on the top of the Yelp list. And now we know why. First of all, the service was excellent. We hung out with great-guy-whose-name-I-can't-remember for like 30 minutes, and I rambled on about sandwiches and my obsession with Kinder Hippos. Meanwhile, he made us three of the best (not to mention cheapest) sandwiches I have had in the last two years (length of my current stay in SF). I had roast beef on a sourdough roll and the last poster is right, the bread is damn delicious. We got the special- sandwiches with a drink and chips for 50 cents more (whaa...?). If I could I would give them an extra star for having the ever-elusive chocolate (vs. white) Kinder Hippo, a very endangered species, considering they didn't even have them in the Munich airport, their native habitat. I went on and on about the Hippos and I thought our new sandwich-making friend was sick of me until, when he came outside to see if we needed anything else (um, hello unexpected amazing service), he was indulging in the sweet hippos of the gods. I will make many more a jaunt out here even though, living in this city, ten minute drives are basically day trips. I love you Handy Deli.
author: Katie T.

description:
What can I say about this place...I love it! Every time I visit Gerias and his wonderfully priced beverages, I hear awesome music, start dancing and am engaged in some chit chat and fun conversation. I've lived in the neighborhood for almost a year and frequent this place a little too often for my own good probably but it's always a very therapeutic and enjoyable experience. Gracias!

Marce
author: marcela a.

description:
I couldn't talk this place up enough if I tried. Awesome beer selection, with great deals and employees who know what they're talking about, who are always around to recommend something good (they haven't let me down yet). My favorite liquor store in the city.

But wait! As if it couldn't get any better!

Please please please treat yourself to one of the sandwiches from Handy Deli. I've tried a few different ones so far and I am already convinced that they are the best sandwiches in the city - fresh, delicious, and surprisingly inexpensive (once you see how big they are, you'll agree). I suggest the classic club, the avocado makes it perfect. 

The location is great, the service is friendly and helpful, and you can tell that the guys there really care about the place. Have a beer, get a sandwich, and you will too.
author: kyle w.

description: havent tried the sandwiches, mostly only come here at night, have only come here for beer. if you want to buy bombers go here they have a great selection of fancy kick ass beers, but their 6 pack selection could use some help. so i say if you want a bomber go to handy if you want a 6 pack go to lucca a few doors down.
author: Sean B.

description: Jerry! Handy Deli is hands down the best liquor store/deli in the sunset if not the whole city. The customer service is second to none, and Jerry is one of the best hosts I've ever met. Good prices, good people, good times!
author: J D.

description: Cheapest Guinness 4-packs in San Francisco and great sandwiches...enough said! 5 stars
author: Phil M.

description: i live in the neighborhood and have been coming to this deli for almost 2 years now.  jerry, the owner, has done a lot with the place and is the nicest guy you'll meet.  they have great (cheap) sandwiches (especially the turkey club), a good selection of wine & liquor, and you feel like part of the family when you come here.
author: Jen V.

description: I never would have considered a corner liquor store could inspire people enough to write reviews- but Jerry and his Handy deli deserve 5 stars and more. This is hands down the best liquor store in the city. Jerry is a man who loves his business- and his community- and it shows. I don't live in the area but have been here a few times when visiting friends, and each time I learn a little more about him, and about the brews and spirits he serves. I count myself lucky to have found out about the tastings he has sponsored in  the community...(I now know I DON'T like smoky scotch, which has saved me a bundle!)... and am super impressed in how conscious he is of trying to build up the whole neighborhood by working in collaboration with other businesses. Why does all this matter in a review, just because it shows how much he cares, and he let's you know it with his friendliness and personal attention every time you enter his store. This is the type of old-fashioned neighborhood service...with great prices... that we are so lacking these days. I live in the Mission, and ONLY buy my liquor here. It's worth it.
author: Tiffany W.
